content.content: Hello voters and lurkers. As many know, there was an informal poll regarding the 84k MKR received from the foundation, and we currently have a signal request to send them to the burner.  While MakerDAO having mint/burn capabilities over MKR may make the “Protocol Treasury” (as it is called on daistats.com) economically meaningless, there can be little doubt it is psychologically significant. I therefore wish to propose that MakerDAO create a highly memetic “Protocol Treasury” hoard by burning MKR from or minting MKR to the treasury to achieve the most infectious meme. Pros  Removes the cognitive overhead of having such a boring Protocol Treasury value Possibly good PR for MakerDAO  Cons  Engineering time to craft the spell Some people could find the meme distasteful Likely additional cost to commission accompanying artwork  Please indicate which numbers you think would be most virulently memorable.  I have included only numbers which will keep the total supply of MKR, including the treasury, under the very nice and memorable “1 million”.    Favorite Treasury Meme Number  1 42 69 420 1337 11111 36666 (ape yearn) 36667 (surpass yearn) 42069 55555 69420 77777 84000.1 (no change) 84048 84848 88888 88888.88888 90210 92429 Abstain     0 voters     Final Results: 75% of votes were Abstain or No Change. Therefore, signal has been closed and no further action will be taken.
content.GPT-summary: The author proposes creating a "Protocol Treasury" meme by burning or minting MKR to achieve the most infectious meme. The post includes a list of numbers for voters to choose from. The proposal is explained in detail, and the author asks for feedback from voters. Some potential pros and cons are listed. The post also includes the final results of the signal request.
GPT-discussion-categories: Author of proposal is explaining proposal

content.content: I have mixed feelings about this idea. On one hand, it’s cute. On the other hand, I wouldn’t want it to divert peoples’ attention from doing real work.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal

content.content: Hey @Spidomo, it doesn’t look like this is going to get much traction at this point, but as a general rule, signal requests have a set of next steps / timelines at the bottom so everyone understands what to expect from the governance process. Could you add that here, or consider closing the signal given the scattered vote participation thus far?
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal

content.content: Final Results: 75% of votes were Abstain or No Change. Therefore, signal has been closed and no further action will be taken.
This topic was automatically closed 30 days after the last reply. New replies are no longer allowed.
